qas.question: When did Diodorus Siculus write Bibliotheca historica?
What battle marks the end of Diodorus Siculus' work?
Which writer outlined the history of important Hellenistic figures?

context: The most important source after Polybius is Diodorus Siculus who wrote his Bibliotheca historica between <a0_0>60 and 30 BCE<a0_0/> and reproduced some important earlier sources such as Hieronymus, but his account of the Hellenistic period breaks off after the <a1_0>battle of Ipsus<a1_0/> (301). Another important source, <a2_0><a4_0>Plutarch<a4_0/><a2_0/>'s (c.50—c.120) Parallel Lives though more preoccupied with issues of personal character and morality, outlines the history of important Hellenistic figures. Appian of <a3_0>Alexandria<a3_0/> (late first century CE-before 165 CE) wrote a history of the Roman empire that includes information of some Hellenistic kingdoms.
